quote: SilenceTHERE is a silence where hath been no sound,	 There is a silence where no sound may be,	 In the cold grave—under the deep, deep sea,	 Or in wide desert where no life is found,	 Which hath been mute, and still must sleep profound;	 No voice is hush'd—no life treads silently,	 But clouds and cloudy shadows wander free,	 That never spoke, over the idle ground:	 But in green ruins, in the desolate walls	 Of antique palaces, where Man hath been,	 Though the dun fox or wild hyæna calls,	 And owls, that flit continually between,	 Shriek to the echo, and the low winds moan—	 There the true Silence is, self-conscious and alone.
author: Thomas Hood

quote: I am speechless: what can I answer?I put hand on my mouth.I have said too much already
author: now I will speak no more.
category: Stephen Mitchell, The Book of Job

quote: The silence is not suppression; instead, it is all there is.
author: Annie Dillard, Teaching a Stone to Talk: Expeditions and Encounters

quote: In the seventh century, Isaac the Syrian wrote about 'stillness,' which in his writings has been summarized as 'a deliberate denial of the gift of words for the sake of achieving inner silence, in the midst of which a person can hear the presence of God. It is standing unceasingly, silent, and prayerfully before God.
author: Kenneth Bailey, Jacob and the Prodigal: How Jesus Re-told Israel's Story

quote: Kyoko sniffs, unable to speak. Sometimes saying nothing means most of all.
author: Sandy Fussell, Shaolin Tiger

quote: ... isn't breaking a supervillian out of jail a little ... much?
author: Kirstin van Dyke, Code Name: Silence
category: book, broderick, character, character-quote, code, linda, name, novel, silence

quote: Silence beyond being the answer to fools, is sometimes the answer of fools.
author: Prinx Maurice

quote: The closest one person can get to another is through silence.
author: Bohumil Hrabal, I Served the King of England

quote: I once traveled with a guide who was taking me to Faya. He didn't speak for nine hours. At the end of it he pointed to the horizon and said, 'Faya!' That was a good day.
author: Michael Ondaatje, The English Patient

quote: Only he who knows how to speak can be silent.
author: Jean-Paul Sartre, We Have Only This Life to Live

quote: Around them there was nothing but silence, as if all the world were holding its breath.
author: Philip Pullman, The Amber Spyglass

quote: He himself was almost never bored, and there was no man with whom it would have been a greater mistake to suppose that silence meant displeasure.
author: Henry James, The American

quote: Don't be afraid to talk because in the long run, you will be afraid that you were too silent.
author: Anthony T. Hincks
category: afraid, don-t, frightened, long-run, philosophy, scared, silence, silent, speak, talk

quote: When once misfortune enters a house, silence is in vain.
author: Maurice Maeterlinck, Pelleas and Melisande

quote: Silence doesn’t have to be a major pilgrimage into the wilderness in order to find a solitary space. Everyday tasks such as driving around town, folding laundry, preparing food, washing dishes, or taking walks can all provide a measure of solitude each day when approached with the right mindset and a commitment to shut off televisions, computers, tablets, smartphones, radios, and anything else that could interrupt silence.
author: Ed Cyzewski, Flee, Be Silent, Pray: An Anxious Evangelical Finds Peace with God through Contemplative Prayer

quote: Celebration toward the east fosters silence. Indeed, there is less temptation for the celebrant to monopolize the conversation. Facing the Lord, he is less tempted to become a professor giving a lesson throughout the Mass, reducing the altar to a podium centered on the microphone instead of the Cross.
author: Robert Sarah, The Power of Silence: Against the Dictatorship of Noise

quote: Coz," he said. "You really must learn to shut your mouth from time to time. You'll taste less shoe letter.
author: Jim Butcher, The Aeronaut's Windlass

quote: He sometimes halted without saying anything. Either he had finally nothing to say or while having something to say he finally decided not to say it.
author: Samuel Beckett, Texts for Nothing and Other Shorter Prose 1950-1976

quote: Silence was my sister's weapon. When people hurt or angered her, she never got loud like Mom or mean and smart-ass like me. Silence was how she fought back. It wasn't passive, or an act of helplessness: it was a cold cruel withering blade, lasting far longer than my mother's rage or my own antagonism, strong enough to make us practically beg for forgiveness every time. Except now her weapon had gone haywire, turned on herself, driven her from her home and her support system and into what-knew-what kind of danger.
author: Sam J. Miller, The Art of Starving

quote: He feels the word close enough to absorb it
author: an exorcised silence creating cliffsides to escape to and reverse.
category: Gwen Calvo, Cocaine Masks: Cocaine Masks

quote: That summer lying in the long grass with my head propped up against the back of a saddle, with the zenith above me and the drop of distance below, I listened to the mountain silence until I could hear as far into it as the faintest clink of a cowbell. In the mountains, what might be out of sight had never really gone away. Like the mountain, that distant bell would always be there. It would keep reminding.
author: Eudora Welty, On Writing

quote: I never speak in silence.
author: Anthony T Hincks
category: never, philosophy, quiet, silence, speak, talk

quote: Silence is not a fucking virtue. It’s a disease—­a cancer that eats away at you and fucks with your head.
author: Jennifer L. Armentrout, Be with Me

quote: Silence is a language in itself. Perhaps the loudest and most beautiful of them all!
author: Tina Sequeira, SOUL SOJOURN

quote: It was almost as if he was giving her his silence, so that all of her anger had a place to go.
author: Jodi Lynn Anderson, Tiger Lily

quote: Silence isn't always agreement. Sometimes people no longer argue because they no longer care.
author: Joyce Rachelle
category: agreeing, agreement, arguing, argument, arguments, conflict, conflict-management, conflicts, confrontations, fighting, introverts, quiet-people, saying-no, saying-yes, silence, silent-treatment

quote: Afraid of offending with an off word or the slightest insensitivity, I keep an unobtrusive and silent distance. Nevertheless, my pursed lips and offish stance are perceived as cold, managing to offend all.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Slaying Dragons
category: offending, offense, perceptions, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich, silence

quote: Life’s most precious moments are not all loud or uproarious. Silence and stillness has its own virtues.
author: Kilroy J. Oldster, Dead Toad Scrolls
category: meditation-experience, meditations-quotes, mindfulness, mindfulness-and-meditation, mindfulness-quotes, peaceful-life, peacefulness, precious-moments, quiet-time, quietude, silence, silence-quote, special-memories, special-moment, special-moments, stillness, stillness-of-mind, stillness-of-the-mind

quote: If my journey was so easy, I would have missed out on life's invaluable lessons. From misery I learnt to comfort those in tears, from lack I learnt to give to the needy; from uncertainty I learnt to understand others and from my silence I learnt to listen to the voiceless.
author: Gift Gugu Mona
category: comfort, easy, invaluable-lessons, journey, lack, misery, need, silence, tears, uncertainty, understand-others, voiceless

quote: Remember, thy own shadow isn't far from thyself; in reality, it always follows thee, even in complete darkness (and in silence).
author: Sandeep N. Tripathi
category: darkness-quotes, reality-of-life, reality-quote, shadow, shadows, shadows-in-the-silence, silence

quote: It was better to leave the space empty of words than to choose the wrong ones.
author: Robin Hobb, Fool's Assassin

quote: Silence is what allows people to suffer without recourse, what allows hypocrisies and lies to grow and flourish, crimes to go unpunished.
author: Rebecca Solnit, The Mother of All Questions

quote: She found herself too visible in silence
author: exposed in the quiet of reflection.

quote: He seemed not to know the uses of silence.
author: Ursula K. Le Guin, The Lathe of Heaven

quote: When the truth is known, all descriptions cease, and silence alone remains. #Yoga Vasistha
author: Abhishek Kumar, Stardust Family - We Are One!
category: abhishek-kumar, abhishek-kumar-india, abhishek-kumar-quotes, cease, descriptions, silence, stardust, stardust-family, stardustak, truth, yoga-vasistha

quote: What is this life! you cry out. Only silence answers, and it is eloquent. Shining eyes open in the darkness, the eyes of that face, smiling too much and too long. Without a word, that smile coerces from you an old question: Was it all so useless? The smile pushes up at its edges, too rigid to be real. You cannot look away as it widens past all natural proportion. There is nothing left but that big smile. It is the last thing you see: a great gaping mouth like the entrance to a carnival ride. Then: the sense of being swallowed. That is the story; that is the plot of our lives.
author: Thomas Ligotti, The Conspiracy Against the Human Race

quote: The person who has read just a single book argues. The person who has read the entire library watches in silence.
author: Unknown

quote: When asked, 'What did you want to say in this work?' he would answer, 'I've said what I've said.'This made sense in where everyone assumed music had a meaning - but where saying the wrong thing could get a person killed.-Symphony for the City of the Dead: Dmitri Shostakovich and the Siege of Leningrad
author: M.T. Anderson

quote: . . . I am in my hermitage perhaps 70 to 80 percent of the time. I relish and enjoy time with others. I have been called "the sociable hermit." Ironically, lengthy solitude often invokes a verbal avalanche when I find myself with a dear and treasured friend, or at a rare social occasion. . . . Solitaries, I suppose, are not always introverts.
author: Barbara Erakko Taylor, Silent Dwellers: Embracing the Solitary Life

quote: For the modern solitary, the quest for silence has vastly broader boundaries than what one's predecessors faced. Solitude is real only when it is relative to the world in which it is lived. It is unreal if attempted in fantasy--as though telephones and fax machines, the Internet and E-mail did not exist. (36)
author: Barbara Erakko Taylor, Silent Dwellers: Embracing the Solitary Life

quote: Things always happen as they should and when they should. Our intuition provides us with guidance on our true purpose. These messages come from the heart. We can only hear them when we're silent not through a cluttered mind.
author: Nanette Mathews
category: awareness, guidance, inner-peace, inspirational, intuition, life-purpose, mindfulness, silence

quote: There was cruelty in silence, and isolation made it worse.
author: Jordan Dane

quote: The silence encompassing the feeling so juvenile, veiling everything but a sham smile.
author: Parul Agrawal

quote: Never allow yourself to believe you should be silent.
author: Samantha Shannon, The Song Rising

quote: That silence intimidates puzzles me. Silence is to me normal, comfortable." Later he added, "I will admit to feeling a little contempt for those who can't keep quiet.
author: Michael Finkel, The Stranger in the Woods: The Extraordinary Story of the Last True Hermit

quote: There was no echo, no reverberation. If anything the room ate sound. It swallowed her voice, her words, and her eternal, inadequate apology. But not her memories. She would never be rid of those.
author: Laini Taylor, Strange the Dreamer

quote: Some secrets are heavy because they aren't yours to tell.
author: Joyce Rachelle

quote: Still, the ten days were enough for me to see, as if peering over the edge of a well, that silence could be mystical, and that if you dared, diving fully into your inner depths might be both profound and disturbing.
author: Michael Finkel, The Stranger in the Woods: The Extraordinary Story of the Last True Hermit

quote: Silence is not a reply. However, it shows a way of avoiding further discussion and critical questions and the escape from the reality or idiocy, since it is a personal diplomacy.
author: Ehsan Sehgal

quote: Reading your sonnets?” asked Orphu. Mahnmut closed the book. “How’d you know? Have you taken up telepathy now that you’ve lost your eyes?” “Not yet,” rumbled the Ionian. Orphu’s great crab shell was lashed to the deck ten meters from where Mahnmut sat near the bow. “Some of your silences are more literary than others, is all.
author: Dan Simmons, Ilium

quote: The Silence of the Final GoodbyeI knew you best from the silences,The time and space in between,The moment before our lips touched,The way your arms went up in the air before you laughed,The smile that we shared before we talked,The redness on your face before your tears,The sensation of your arms around me after you released the embrace.The look you gave me before you walked away,Nothing had ever been so painful,No words could say what your eyes told me,When I wake in the morning without you,It’s the first thing I hear…The silence of the final goodbye.
author: Jacqueline Simon Gunn
category: grief-quotes, life-experience, loss-of-love, love, romance, romance-novels, silence, silence-communication, silence-speaks

quote: It's been said that actions speak louder than words. Sometimes, it's what you don't say or do, that sends the loudest message.
author: Carlos Wallace, The Other 99 T.Y.M.E.S: Train Your Mind to Enjoy Serenity

quote: If I didn’t look too closely, I wouldn’t see that Tiras wasn’t there. If I didn’t breathe too deeply, I wouldn’t feel the hollow echo in my empty chest. If I didn’t move too quickly, I wouldn’t reach any painful conclusions. And if I didn’t listen, I wouldn’t hear the silence he always left behind.
author: Amy Harmon, The Bird and the Sword

quote: that we die, our very humanity slayed, whenever we choose to remain silent in the face of tyranny.
author: Okey Ndibe, Never Look an American in the Eye: A Memoir of Flying Turtles, Colonial Ghosts, and the Making of a Nigerian American

quote: Silence is the small man’s only defense.
author: Karan Mahajan, The Association of Small Bombs

quote: People should think of their words like seeds. They should plant them, then let them grow in silence. Our old people taught us that the earth is always speaking to us, but that we have to be silent to hear her.
author: Kent Nerburn, Neither Wolf nor Dog: On Forgotten Roads with an Indian Elder

quote: Silence is difficult and arduous, it is not to be played with. It isn't something that you can experience by reading a book, or by listening to a talk, or by sitting together, or by retiring into a wood or a monastery. I am afraid none of these things will bring about this silence. This silence demands intense psychological work. You have to be burningly aware of your snobbishness, aware of your fears, your anxieties, your sense of guilt. And when you die to all that, then out of that dying comes the beauty of silence.
author: Jiddu Krishnamurti, The Collected Works of J. Krishnamurti, Vol 13 1962-63: A Psychological Revolution

quote: Silence is sometimes an argument of Consent
author: Thomas Hobbes

quote: Only their efforts to make him talk failed. he would say one word at a time, if pressed, but seemed happier not to and could not be made to repeat a whole line. Gradually, as his family learnt how to anticipate his few needs and how to respond, they ceased to notice his silence -his manner of communication seemed full and rich enough to them: he no more needed to converse than Aunt Mira's cat did.
author: Anita Desai, Clear Light of Day

quote: There's a lot to be said for the fellow who doesn't say it himself.
author: Maurice Switzer

quote: There are many kinds of silences and not all signify absence or vacancy....Those moments are but temporary ebbs before the flow of meaning rushes in to fill the space....God may be speaking 'in ways we have yet to recognize as speech.
author: Terryl L. Givens, The Crucible of Doubt: Reflections On the Quest for Faith

quote: who knows your silence is screening some back stage trouble for me as I have spoken truth .
author: litymunshi
category: care, danger-stop, life, love, silence, trap

quote: Behind the depressing silence of the sea, the silence of God …. the feeling that while men raise their voices in anguish God remains with folded arms, silent.
author: Shūsaku Endō, Silence

quote: The silence is becoming more poisonous and I have no one to talk with, not even my own self
author: Hilal Hamdaan

quote: Periods of silent solitude spent in introspective reflecting are sacred and a source of great strength and comfort. We can learn from listening to the rhythms of nature and from appreciating the eternal hush of the cosmos.
author: Kilroy J. Oldster, Dead Toad Scrolls
category: introspection, introspective, silence, silence-quote, solitude, solitude-quotes

quote: Are you listening to the ones who keep quiet?
author: Joubert

quote: It had started snowing, a thick wet layer of slush that won't stick. There are no cars on the road, nothing but big white flakes falling onto our faces, erasing the buildings around us, and the low swish of our feet on the road as we try to keep our footing, a soft wheeze humming from the bottom of my lungs from too much smoking.In the middle of Nation Road, Mazzie turns to me without any warning. She grabs my arm and we both fall down, and then we're sitting there in the middle of the bare road, and for a few seconds we just sit there, quite, listening to the eerie silent noise of snow falling against land.Snow covers Mazzie's eyelashes, making her look like a tiny ice princess– the closest she will ever come to wearing makeup."You look pretty," I say."Shut up.
author: Jessica Warman, Breathless

quote: When we are young the noise of general conversation seems much the most fun. When we grow up we discover the possibilities of the tete-a-tete. In maturity the monologue habit sets is. But now at last there is the chance to investigate the rich depth of the silence when the monologue is suspended.
author: Nanamoli Thera

quote: He looked down at the street, and the unbroken whiteness, and watched his foot touch the snow and listened to the slight crunching sound as he stepped forward. He looked back at his footprints. They were fascinating. He had been the only one to walk along this street today. There wasn’t even the mark of a dog or squirrel, or the scratch of a bird. He continued through the soft, silent snow, a feeling of peace starting to flow through him, helping make his step lighter and easier.
author: Hubert Selby Jr., Song of the Silent Snow

quote: He looked at the houses he had been passing these weeks and though he had never studied them carefully they had become familiar through the process of seeing them so often, and he was now impressed with the change in their appearance as he looked at them through the gray of the air and whiteness of the snow, each house, shrub, tree, bush and mailbox trimmed with snow and blending into the air as if they were just a picture projected upon the still, pearly grayness, just an impression created by the silent snow, a picture on the edge and verge of disappearing and leaving only the air and snow through which he now lightly walked.It did not seem possible, but the air was even softer and quieter. He continued walking alongside his prints feeling he could walk forever, that as long as the silent snow continued falling he could continue walking, and as he did he would leave behind all worries and cares, all horrors of the past and future. There would be nothing to bother him or torture his mind and fill his body with tremors of fear, the dark night of the soul over. There would only be himself and the soft, silent snow; and each flake, in its own life, its own separate and distinct entity, would bring with it its own joy, and he would easily partake of that joy as he continued walking, the gentle, silent snow falling ever so quietly, ever so joyously ... yes, and ever so love-ing-ly ... loveing-ly....
author: Hubert Selby Jr., Song of the Silent Snow

quote: Silence heals nothing, fixes nothing, and unlocks nothing. Just because you don’t say something doesn’t make it any less true.
author: Mary Calmes, Crucible of Fate

quote: Silence is the sleep that nourishes wisdom.
author: Francis Bacon

quote: I keep thinkingThat poetry is something else:A form of love that exists only in silence,In a secret place between two people,Almost always between two strangers
author: José Emilio Pacheco

quote: I think sometimes, being silent and watching, can change a person.
author: Shannon Hale, Book of a Thousand Days

quote: And remember, silence is all it takes to validate evil and remember, indifference is all it takes to endorse it.
author: Adeosun Olamide

quote: In every story there is a silence, some sight concealed, some word unspoken, I believe. Till we have spoken the unspoken we have not come to the heart of the story.
author: J.M. Coetzee
category: foe, j-m-coetzee, reflection, silence, story, truth

quote: That is the idea he is toying with, Renzo says, to write an essay about the things that don’t happen, the lives not lived, the wars not fought, the shadow worlds that run parallel to the world we take to be the real world, the not-said and the not-done, the not-remembered.
author: Paul Auster, Sunset Park

quote: The bigness of the West makes men quiet
author: they seldom talk unless they have something to say.
category: William S. Hart, My Life East & West

quote: Ultimately, our questions must emerge not from mental categories, but from deep within the heart. They must rise to the surface of our beings as we sit in silence, so that they are not just the old questions which we raise whenever we have nothing else to talk about or just for the sake of argument. They need to be the questions which make a difference in our lives.
author: Zalman Schachter-Shalomi, Credo of a Modern Kabbalist

quote: Never underestimate the effect of well-timed silence.
author: Bruce Rhoades

quote: Best of the conversations are sometimes made in silence..
author: Danya Krish

quote: The child's reluctance to speak for the first few months of his residence in a new country is not pathological, but normal.
author: Stephen D. Krashen, The Input Hypothesis: Issues and Implications

quote: I defendNot my voice, but my silence
author: Anna Akhmatova, The Complete Poems of Anna Akhmatova

quote: He grinned back at me, and I remembered how normal he’d made me feel the first time we’d met. Here, once again, he wasn’t bothered by my silence. And I suddenly realized what made me feel so uncomfortable about Elizabeth’s exploits. The people she attracted were drawn to the same thing everyone else was: our glowing skin, dreamy eyes, and air of secrecy. But this boy? He seemed to see more than that. He saw me not just as a mysterious beauty, but as a girl he wanted to know.He didn’t stare at me. He spoke to me.
author: Kiera Cass, The Siren

quote: It is only through silence that truth can be said, because it is only through silence that the truth is heard.
author: Osho, Ancient Music in the Pines: In Zen Mind Suddenly Stops

quote: Sometimes, there's no one around to tell you to be quiet... to be very, very quiet. Sometimes you need to be quiet when you're all alone.
author: Jay Asher, Thirteen Reasons Why

quote: The mansion was as silent as I wished the inside of my head could be. No noise – not even a ragged inhale of breath or a whispered word. Truly blissful.
author: Jennifer L. Armentrout, The Return

quote: He looked at her, and she couldn't contradict him. Nor could she offer any false reassurance. Silence, at least, was honest.
author: Tess Gerritsen, Life Support

quote: All the happiness of man stems from one thing only: that he is incapable of staying quietly in his room.
author: Paul Auster
category: alone, capability, happiness, room, silence, unhappiness

quote: A thousand prayers every minute everywhere and what does God ever say back? Nothing! Because silence never lies. Silence is God's final advantage. Silence is the purest form of harmony. Everyone ought to try it.
author: Joe Hill, The Fireman

quote: Silence prevailed everywhere, like the gloomy dumbness after the riots in the city.
author: Girdhar Joshi, Some Mistakes Have No Pardon

quote: At a stage in life, you learn to talk less. That is, let your works do the talking. Hence, work hard in silence. The evidence will be clear for all to see.
author: Oscar Bimpong
category: evidence-based-decision-making, silence, talk, talk-less, work-hard, works

quote: These woods are where silence has come to lick its wounds.
author: Samantha Hunt, Mr. Splitfoot

quote: My silence doesn't mean I don't know what goes around me, but what goes around me don't deserve my words.
author: Eyden I., Woman's Book: Only For Men

quote: Contemplation in life is more important than bullshit. So enjoy Silence.
author: Eyden I.

quote: Have we,” asks Claude de Saint-Martin, the great ‘unknown philosopher,’ “have we advanced one step further on the radiant path of enlightenment, that leads to the simplicity of men?” Let us wait in silence: perhaps ere long we shall be conscious of “the murmur of the gods.
author: Maurice Maeterlinck, The Treasure of the humble

quote: Jack Miles's wonderful literary reading of the Hebrew Bible as a biography of God offers the insight that after the Book of Job, God never speaks again. God may seem to silence Job, but Job silences God. It is lovely that Job silencing God is part of the text (though likely an accidental order of the books), because it reflects a real change in the real world after the Book of Job came into it.
author: Jennifer Michael Hecht, Doubt: A History: The Great Doubters and Their Legacy of Innovation from Socrates and Jesus to Thomas Jefferson and Emily Dickinson

quote: More than ever at that instant did she long for speech - speech that would conceal and protect where dangerous silence might betray.
author: L.M. Montgomery, Kilmeny of the Orchard

quote: You don't have to say anything if you don't want to."Anna lies down, her head pillowed against my shoulder. Every second, another streak of silver glows: parentheses, exclamation points, commas—a whole grammar made of light, for words too hard to speak.
author: Jodi Picoult, My Sister's Keeper

quote: We fall back into silence. I look around XO Café and notice that chatter happens mostly at tables where the diners are young and hip. The older couples, the ones sporting wedding bands that wink with their silverware, eat without the pepper of conversation. Is it because they are so comfortable, they already know what the other is thinking? Or is it because after a certain point, there is simply nothing left to say?
author: Jodi Picoult, My Sister's Keeper
category: comfort, communication, conversation, love, sara-fitzgerald, silence

quote: The room rang with her voice, then with silence. In the shaded darkness, silence had the quality of a looming dragon. It seemed to roar and the roar to reverberate, to dominate. To escape from it would require a burst of recklessness, even cruelty.
author: Anita Desai, Clear Light of Day

quote: Why are we so afraid of silence? Teenagers cannot study without their records; they walk along the street with their transistors. Grownups are as bad if not worse; we turn on the TV or the radio the minute we come into the house or start the car. The pollution of noise in our cities is as destructive as the pollution of air. We show our fear of silence in our conversation: I wonder if the orally-minded Elizabethan's used "um" and "er" the way we do? And increasingly prevalent is what my husband calls an articulated pause: "You know." We interject "you know" meaninglessly into every sentence, in order that the flow of our speech should not be interrupted by such a terrifying thing as silence.
author: Madeleine L'Engle

quote: To admire me is to admire my silence,Petra HermansSeptember 5, 2016
author: Petra Hermans

quote: We all were silent for a reason, maybe our hearts were talking to us, and it is a human behavior whenever someone is in a crisis or something great is happening, our hearts speaks to us. More and more, only that time because we are too obsessed to use our brains after every work every day that listening to heart becomes secondary
author: Shaikh Ashraf, Friendship, Love & Sacrifice

quote: And then there's silence. Though is silence the right word when, through the quiet, the air is so charged, electricity crackles deafeningly without making a sound?
author: Riley Edgewood, Truth & Temptation

quote: You are not responsible for the past, but insofar as you do nothing, you are complicit in the present created by it.
author: Jonathan R. Miller

quote: Every person interprets the silence that surrounds him or her. The eternal silence of the universe that we exist in is terrifying because it forces each of to ask what our purpose is, why are we here, and what should I do?
author: Kilroy J. Oldster, Dead Toad Scrolls
category: eternity, meaning-of-life, philosophy-of-life, purpose-of-life, purpose-of-life-quotes, self-determination, self-reflection, silence

quote: Silence: the motor drive of nothingness underneath all rhythm - threatened to last forever, a spell of sleep cast over the entire kingdom of listeners.
author: Richard Powers, The Time of Our Singing

quote: Tact by its nature entails staying mum, prudently electing to forgo urging other people to pursue an alternative course of action. Creation of silent spaces in our own life and equitable distribution of periods of respite that allow for periods of equable inner reflection is necessary to spur personal growth. It is equally important to honor other people’s intrinsic need for periods of introspection, uninterrupted by unsolicited advice
author: Kilroy J. Oldster, Dead Toad Scrolls
category: diplomatic, introspection, privacy, private-life, prudence, respecting-others, self-reflection, silence, tact

quote: If my journey was so easy, I would have missed out on life's invaluable lessons. From misery I learnt to comfort those in tears, from lack I learnt to give to the needy; from uncertainty I learnt to understand others and from my silence I learnt to speak for the voiceless.
author: Gugu Mona
category: comfort, easy, give, invaluable-lessons, journey, lack, learn, life, misery, needy, silence, speak, uncertainity, understand, voiceless

quote: A pause gives you breathing spaceso listen to the whispersof the real youwaiting to happen.
author: Tara Estacaan
category: alone, breaking-dawn, breathing-in-awareness, pause, reflections, restore, silence

quote: He stayed inside his perfect silence, hung on the stopped, forward edge of nowhere
author: Richard Powers, The Time of Our Singing

quote: Sometimes silence can kill that a sword cannot
author: Mohammed Mushtaq GK

quote: If you cannot understand me in my speech, how can you understand me in my silence?
author: Ravi Zacharias, Jesus Among Other Gods: The Absolute Claims of the Christian Message

quote: Real compassion only exists in silence
author: Petra Hermans

quote: And so I would like to thank you. You taught me, again and again again and again and again, not to dream of you. And I listened. I am silent. These words are not words of love, but of the silence that will remain when I walk away when this letter is done. I have listened and I do not continue to imagine our love, for it was not love. You were too busy walking a flowered path, and it was my misstep that I thought we had something more than an hour’s fun for you.Thank you, for clarifying for me what love is not.Love is no thing, and nothing is a gift, space is a playground, and time and distance are merely peaks and valleys in the topography of real love.And I would remind you: I am not one of your fans. For I know what I deserve, and it is one who is not afraid of fear. Love does not require this map: it makes its way across the miles. Love does not heed the time; it is not rooted in the months of one or two moons. Love is not bothered by obstacles—they form the high sides to the left and right of this rocky path. This path does not depend upon external signs: love will find its own way.
author: Waylon H. Lewis, Things I Would Like To Do With You

quote: The world is drowned in silence, who will tell your story ? Who tells doesn't know you and who knows, cannot say it.
author: Syed Azeem Bukhari

quote: [W]e are none of us very good at silence. It says too much.
author: Frederick Buechner, Telling the Truth: The Gospel as Tragedy, Comedy, and Fairy Tale

quote: When the silence of the night becomes the chanting of poetry, the departure of con-cavity
author: Goitsemang Mvula

quote: There are so many different forms of silence: the silence that tyrannical states force on their citizens, stealing their memories, rewriting their histories, and imposing on them a state-sanctioned identity. Or the silence of witnesses who choose to ignore or not speak the truth, and of victims who at times become complicit in the crimes committed against them. Then there are the silences we indulge in about ourselves, our personal mythologies, the stories we impose upon our real lives.
author: Azar Nafisi, Things I've Been Silent About: Memories

quote: Silence, like salt, only seems to be weightless. In reality, if one allows time to dampen it, it grows heavy as an anvil.
author: Guadalupe Nettel

quote: Volumes are spoken when nothing is being said.
author: R.J. Torbert, No Mercy

quote: One of the greatest skills any leader can master is becoming comfortable with silence.
author: David Grossman

quote: Sometimes I struggled to say something meaningful only to learn that silence is just as powerful as words.
author: Alfredo Quinones-Hinojosa, Becoming Dr. Q: My Journey from Migrant Farm Worker to Brain Surgeon

quote: Dissociation appears to be... the internal mechanism by which terrorized people are silenced.
author: Judith Lewis Herman, Trauma and Recovery: The Aftermath of Violence - From Domestic Abuse to Political Terror
category: dissociation, dissociative-disorders, silence, silence-speaks, silenced, terror, traumatized

quote: But once, in his anger, Aidan had asked me whether I thought I had wasted my life, and I had told him no. No, I had not. But I had been wrong. And Tom Cardle has been right. For I had known everything, right from the start, and never acted on any of it. I had blocked it from my mind time and again, refused to recognize what was staring me in the face. I had said nothing when I should have spoken out, convincing myself that I was a man of higher character. I had been complicit in all their crimes, and people had suffered because of me. I had wasted my life. I had wasted every moment of my life. And the final irony was that it had taken a convicted pedophile to show me that in my silence, I was just as guilty as the rest of them.
author: John Boyne, A History of Loneliness

quote: When I am in a situation where I feel uncomfortable about speaking but it is necessary for me to speak, or if I feel 'put on the spot' my voice sounds strained, really weird, and it feels as if I have no control over how I sound in these situations. Sometimes then my voice is barely audible and I am frequently asked to repeat myself. Attempts at speaking are often embarrassing, shaming experiences for me. I sound quite different when speaking with someone I am more relaxed with, but I don't like the way my voice sounds at the best of times; I was horrified when I heard a recording of myself. Because of this inhibition about speaking, I have never learned to project my voice or to use it effectively. I often feel that I could no more use my vocal cords to break a silence, to get somebody's attention or to initiate an interaction than I could run through fire or do something dangerous in my life.
author: Carl Sutton, Selective Mutism In Our Own Words: Experiences in Childhood and Adulthood

quote: My silence never means I don’t have nothing to talk, but it was important who were audiences and what was the topic.
author: Ali Rezavand Zayeri
category: audiences, silence, silent, social-norms, speaking, talk, topic

quote: Silence is often a measure of success.
author: Michael Bungay Stanier

quote: Thus his belief was that in a service where feeling could be restrained it ought to be restrained. The power of God was more likely to be known in a solemn stillness than amid noise and excitement. Silence and an expectant seriousness, born of a realisation of the nearness of God, were striking characteristics of the services at Sandfields.
author: Iain H. Murray, The Life of Martyn Lloyd-Jones - 1899-1981
category: emotion, martyn-lloyd-jones, mlj, sandfields, silence, worship

quote: Silence is a prince's friend.
author: George R.R. Martin, A Feast for Crows

quote: Over the years, they’d become accomplished at avoiding unpleasant topics. Their burdened demeanors spoke volumes through the silence.
author: Glenn B Miller, The Barrier: Parental concern never ends

quote: I'd like to turn the silence right up, but how do you do that?
author: Valérie Zenatti, A Bottle in the Gaza Sea

quote: ChrysanthemumSilence - monk Sips his morning tea.
author: Bashō Matsuo, Lips Too Chilled

quote: I had dedicated my life to words. But sometimes, words are not needed.
author: Jordan L. Hawk, Widdershins

quote: Silence is the loudest sound!
author: Gabriella Jording

quote: In the summer,on fine evenings, I love to drive late andalone in the scented forests, and when I havereached a dark part stop, and sit quite still, listeningto the nightingales repeating their little tune overand over aga^n after interludes of gurgling, or ifthere are no nightingales, listening to the marvelloussilence, and letting its blessedness descend intomy very souL The nightingales in the forestsabout here all sing the same tune, and in the samekey of (E flat).
author: Elizabeth von Arnim

quote: The silence wasn't like the ones I'd known lately, though; it wasn't empty so much as chosen. There's an entirely different feel to quiet when you're with someone else, and at any moment it could be broken. Like the difference between a pause and an ending.
author: Sarah Dessen, The Truth About Forever

quote: I did not speak. I have found in any Q&A, in court, in witness interviews, wherever, often the best thing you can do is wait, say nothing. The witness will want to fill the awkward silence. He will feel a vague compassion to keep talking, to prove he is not holding back, to prove he is smart and in the know, to earn your trust.
author: William Landay, Defending Jacob

quote: The classroom fell quiet, a long heavy silence that roared in Roy's ears like a train.
author: Carl Hiaasen, Hoot

quote: Silence is also a form of speaking. They’re exactly alike. It’s a basic component of language. We’re always selecting what we say and what we don’t. Why do we say one thing and not the other? And we do this instinctively, too, because no matter what we’re talking about, there’s more that doesn’t get said than does. And this isn’t always to hide things—it’s simply part of an instinctive selection in our speech. This selection varies from one person to the next, so that no matter how many people describe the same thing, the descriptions are different, the point of view is different. And even if there is a similar viewpoint, people make different choices as to what is said or not said. This was very clear to me, coming from the village, since the people there never said more than they absolutely needed to. When I was fifteen and went to the city, I was amazed at how much people talked and how much of that talk was pointless. And how much people talked about themselves—that was totally alien to me.For me, silence had always been another form of communication. After all, you can tell so much just by looking at a person. At home we always knew about each other even if we didn’t talk about ourselves all the time. I encountered a lot of silence elsewhere as well. There was the silence that was self-imposed, because you could never say what you really thought.
author: Herta Müller

quote: In the heart, silence becomes an echo of unanswered needs
author: Bluenscottish

quote: I sit beside the momentThat stares at silenceBefore anything could happen
author: Sayantan Sen, Quiet: A collection of poems

quote: The best way to support terrorism is to be silent.
author: Sercan Leylek

quote: She sat in the silence that resulted in the absence of her words, feeling unburdened but not absolved.
author: Thomm Quackenbush, Flies to Wanton Boys

quote: Information is like water. It finds its way to all the wrong places.
author: Dexter Hawk, 25 Things to Say to the Interviewer, to Get the Job You Want: Being Qualified Isn't Enough

quote: In an age that valued prolonged and detailed exposition, complexity, and repetition it was astonishing that Luther should have instinctively discerned the value of brevity.
author: Andrew Pettegree, Brand Luther: How an Unheralded Monk Turned His Small Town into a Center of Publishing, Made Himself the Most Famous Man in Europe—and Started the Protestant Reformation

quote: For one who knows not God – Mighty and Glorious!- silence is imperative, and for one who knows God Most High silence is prescribed.
author: حجة الإسلام أبو حامد محمد الغزالي

quote: I maintained a tactical silence. When you maintain a tactical silence and look people right in the eye, as if drinking in their words, they talk. People like to be listened to, as every researcher knows--every researcher, every writer, every spy.
author: Michel Houellebecq, Soumission

quote: I know there is a moment when sound slips down the torn lining of itself into silence, is carried unheard and secret in its own pocket. But the crimson birds could find no such escape, no means of slipping beyond themselves between the cracks of color and song to a white undiscovered silence.
author: Janet Frame, The Edge of the Alphabet

quote: Let thy speech be better than silence, or be silent.
author: Pseudo-Dionysius the Areopagite

quote: The overpowering unimportance of this MAKES ME SPEECHLESS. – Speaker of the House of Representatives Thomas Reed
author: Barbara W. Tuchman, The Proud Tower: A Portrait of the World Before the War, 1890-1914

quote: When it occurs without having to voice it - vibin' on the same page, flowin' on the same wave, soakin' up the same light rays.
author: T.F. Hodge, From Within I Rise: Spiritual Triumph Over Death and Conscious Encounters with "The Divine Presence"
category: communication, duality, equally-yoked, non-verbal-communication, silence, soulmate, telepathic-dreaming, telepathy

quote: If there must be a god in the house, must be,Saying things in the rooms and on the stair,Let him move as the sunlight moves on the floor,Or moonlight, silently, as Plato's ghostOr Aristotle's skeleton. Let him hang outHis stars on the wall. He must dwell quietly.
author: Wallace Stevens, The Collected Poems

quote: Mr Rycroft said nothing. It was so difficult not to say the wrong thing to Captain Wyatt that it was usually safer not to reply at all.
author: Agatha Christie, The Sittaford Mystery

quote: Shhhhhhhh..... Be silent. Silence your mind and listen.... Let the voice of your soul echo and shiiiiine!
author: Angie karan

quote: One's silence can be deafening indeed,but it's also quite satisfying once in a while to actually hear one's thoughts just to reassure a presence.
author: Will Leamon

quote: Most often, their association was one of silence, but that is a thing of uncommon worth when partaken of in the ease of another.
author: A.S. Peterson, Fiddler's Green

quote: He recognizes voices within silence. (of Max Sebald)
author: Patti Smith, M Train

quote: What can you talk to sky? Just nothing...simply enjoy the vastness and magnanimity. What can you talk to ocean? Nothing....enjoy the waves.
author: Aditya Ajmera
category: emptiness, enjoy-the-moment, present-moment, silence, silence-within, universe

quote: I knowThat I can't sit hereAnd expect my silenceTo evoke changeWithout reason.
author: Jordan Hoechlin

quote: You can kill a book quicker by your silence than by a bad review.
author: E.A. Bucchianeri
category: bad-book-review, bad-book-reviews, book, book-review, book-reviews, books, criticism, how-to-kill-a-book, kill, kill-a-book, literary-criticism, publicity, review, reviewing, reviews, sad-but-true, silence, silence-kills, truth

quote: It was normal for it to rain, but in October- who could forget the rains of October?- now this disturbingly silent rain was falling. That was so nebulous that it was pretty; that, if it had not been wet, no one would have believed it was raining; that was so slow that it was possible to follow its fall with one's eyes. That which villagers called 'the rains of October' was the accumulation of the serenity of such a life. Eyes almost broke into tears on looking at the sun subdividing itself, at the end of the afternoon, in each drop of that snail's-pace precipitation, as if the great star had dissolved each day an infinitesimal bit more.
author: Ondjaki, The Whistler
category: afternoon, great-star, october, rain, silence, silent, slow, soft

quote: Good taste, the last and vilest of human superstitions, has succeeded in silencing us where all the rest has failed.
author: G.K. Chesterton, Heretics

quote: Inspired action is when you take action with no mind. Pure silence.
author: Matthew Donnelly

quote: Who says that we always have to be ready to communicate?
author: Sherry Turkle, Alone Together: Why We Expect More from Technology and Less from Each Other

quote: His silence helps him come off as something of a seer, a whispering muse.
author: Davis Miller, Approaching Ali: A Reclamation in Three Acts

quote: Silence is never an admission. We learn that in law school.
author: Kenneth Eade, The Spy Files

quote: Being skilled in Catsism is like being a ninja only deadlier and not so silent. The only bad thing is the sickening grammar you have to use.
author: Will Advise, Nothing is here...
category: being, cat, cats, dead, deadly, death, grammar, mark-twain, meow, ninja, ninjas, nothing, sarcasm, sickening, silence, silent, skill, skilled, skillful, usage

quote: My silence is my self-defence.
author: Jenim Dibie, The Calligraphy of God

quote: Silence is the best language to speak in when you have lots of things to say.
author: Suman Pokhrel

quote: Sometimes silence is the only therapy you need.
author: Karen A. Baquiran

quote: What keeps my heart awake is colorful silence.
author: Claude Monet

quote: Silence is also a form of speaking.
author: Herta Müller

quote: In their silence they continued both to protect me and to punish me. The memory of that night was now the only tie between us, eclipsing everything else.
author: Jhumpa Lahiri, Unaccustomed Earth

quote: It is foolish to be lavish in words and niggardly in truth.
author: Charles Haddon Spurgeon, Lectures to My Students

quote: But they did not chatter much, for the boy, when he liked a person, would as soon sit silent in his company as speak.
author: E.M. Forster, The Celestial Omnibus and other Stories

quote: I thought no one was talking to me and the others thought I wasn't talking to them.
author: Jeanette Winterson

quote: Mass media has convinced us to think that silence is only supposed to happen as a manifestation of supreme actualization, where both parties are so at peace with their emotional connection that it cannot be expressed through the rudimentary tools of the lexicon; otherwise, silence is proof that the magic is gone and the relationship is over (hence the phrase “We just don’t talk anymore”).
author: Chuck Klosterman, Sex, Drugs, and Cocoa Puffs: A Low Culture Manifesto

quote: Silence is the biggest weapon sometime..
author: Debolina Bhawal

quote: Men who cannot be silent will not say anything when they talk.
author: A.W. Tozer

quote: A pregnant pause with enough gestation can give birth to a well formed idea.
author: Khang Kijarro Nguyen

quote: If people were silent, they could hear the noise of their own lives better. If people were silent, it would make what they did say, whenever they chose to say it, more important. If people were silent, they could read one another's signals, the way underwater creatures flash lights at one another, or turn their skin different colors.
author: Ali Benjamin, The Thing About Jellyfish

quote: I choose to love you in silence, for in silence I find no rejection.I choose to love you in loneliness, for in loneliness no one owns you but me.I choose to adore you from a distance, for distance will shield me from pain.I chose to kiss you in the wind, for the wind is gentler than my lips.I choose to hold you in my dreams, for in my dreams you have no end.
author: Jalaluddin Rumi
category: dreams, endings, kisses, love, missing, rejections, secrets, silence

quote: Enjoy TheSound Of Silence.
author: Timothy Salter, Reflections in Short Poetry

quote: Silence introduced in a society that worships noise is like the Moon exposing the night. Behind darkness is our fear. Within silence our voice dwells. What is required from both is that we be still. We focus. We listen. We see and we hear. The unexpected emerges.
author: Terry Tempest Williams, When Women Were Birds: Fifty-four Variations on Voice

quote: Silence is not the absence of something but the presence of everything . . . It is the presence of time, undisturbed. It can be felt within the chest. Silence nurtures our nature, our human nature, and lets us know who we are. Left with a more receptive mind and a more attuned ear, we become better listeners not only to nature but to each other. Silence can be carried like embers from a fire. Silence can be found, and silence can find you. Silence can be lost and also recovered. But silence cannot be imagined, although most people think so. To experience the soul-swelling wonder of silence, you must hear it.
author: Gordon Hempton

quote: Silence is its own kind of tension.
author: Erika Swyler

quote: The desert became grim, dark and foreboding. A silence of death lay over the land, and it seemed as though the very stars held their breath and twinkled no more.
author: Alan Kinross, Longinus The Vampire: Babylon
category: breath, dark, death, desert, foreboding, silence, stars

quote: ... the silenceHolds with its gloved handThe wild hawk of the mind.
author: R.S. Thomas

quote: A mist crept into the valley—how could this be, by the light of the climbing sun? It drifted over the form in the grass, nearly obscuring it, seeming to draw all sound into itself. I thought I might burst from the strain of that silence... until a single sound shattered it:The gasp of an indrawn breath.
author: Tosca Lee, Havah: The Story of Eve
category: breath, creation, creation-of-man, life, silence, sound

quote: Silence is the room we create for the searching of God, where we hear His voice and follow.
author: Mark Buchanan, Your God Is Too Safe: Rediscovering the Wonder of a God You Can't Control

quote: When silence is a living thing, it can be a friend, sometimes even a comfort.
author: Dot Hutchison, A Wounded Name

quote: Everything was for this moment- of silence, of bliss! I am speechless at this shrine of You and I understand that life was just a journey to find You, the deepest consciousness living in even the dead!
author: Preeth Nambiar, The Solitary Shores

quote: Otherwise the silence in the room was profound, the silence of places Brian had not yet been: gazing at the lifeless body of a beloved, the echo of a lost illusion, the tinnitus of betrayal.
author: Rafael Yglesias, The Wisdom of Perversity

quote: You create silent enemies by revealing how much God had blessed you.
author: Michael Bassey Johnson, The Infinity Sign
category: blessed, blessing, enemies, haters, hatred, michael-bassey-johnson, reveal, silence, silent, talkative, testimony

quote: Silence is what causes most of humanities problems.
author: Lauren Kate, Teardrop

quote: Silent is an anagram of listen.
author: Johnny Rich, The Human Script
category: anagrams, calm, hearing, listening, peace, quiet, silence, tranquility

quote: he looks the waysilence looks before it’s broken
author: Andrew McMillan, Every Salt Advance

quote: We refuse to turn off our computers, turn off our phones, log off Facebook, and just sit in silence, because in those moments we might actually have to face up to who we really are. We fear silence like it's an invisible monster, gnawing at us, ripping us open, and showing us our dissatisfaction. Silence is terrifying.
author: Jefferson Bethke, Jesus > Religion: Why He Is So Much Better Than Trying Harder, Doing More, and Being Good Enough
category: computers, dissatisfaction, face-up, facebook, phones, silence

quote: There's just as much to be heard in silence as there is in a room filled with words.
author: TemitOpe Ibrahim
category: attention, inspirational, motivation, noise, perspective, room, silence, wisdom

quote: There was the cruel kind of Eustace silence.
author: James Purdy, Eustace Chisholm and the Works

quote: It's all about inner silence! Everything else would just take you there!
author: Preeth Nambiar, The Voyage to Eternity

quote: Seek O mortal, the meaning of life in your innermost silence!
author: Preeth Nambiar, The Voyage to Eternity

quote: Yet, the most wonderful in my heart remains unsaid and it will remain so forever!
author: Preeth Nambiar, The Solitary Shores

quote: In the silence, while awaiting the distant footsteps of death he heard someone weeping! O God, was that you?
author: Preeth Nambiar, The Solitary Shores
category: death, god, preeth-nambiar, preeth-nambiar-poetry, silence, the-solitary-shores

quote: I will look at you in the darkness of the night, where there are no colours to fill my eyes and where there are no frames that would define your shape. In the silence, I will seek the warmth of the night in your memories and sleep holding tight those orphan dreams. O dear, amidst the cloudy skies, where did you disappear?
author: Preeth Nambiar, The Solitary Shores

quote: Silence is a 'contingent' phenomenon with positive or negative qualities. When it has to be assessed it needs to be 'contextualized' by exploring its background.
author: Erik Pevernagie

quote: We become equally responsible for the actions of others the instant we become conscious of what they are doing wrong but remain silent because we think it is right.
author: Suzy Kassem, Rise Up and Salute the Sun: The Writings of Suzy Kassem
category: actions, conscience, conscious, responsibilty, right, silence, silent, wrong

quote: Life is a dash. Pause in the present. Enjoy this moment.
author: J.R. Rim
category: dash, enjoy-it, happiness, happy, life-is, life-is-beautiful, pause, peace, presence-of-god, present, present-moment, serenity, silence

quote: There is something subversive about this garden of Serena's, a sense of buried things bursting upwards, wordlessly, into the light, as if to point, to say: Whatever is silenced will clamor to be heard, though silently.
author: Margaret Atwood, The Handmaid's Tale

quote: Om is the signature sound of this Universe. It is the soundless sound of existence.
author: Banani Ray
category: cosmic, non-duality, om, religion, silence, sound, soundless-sound, universe

quote: Within the caves of deepest longing Echoes the sounds of majestic eve! Upon the sphere of bright white skies Spreads the paint of evening colours!Silence divine, Penetrates deep Onto the void of ethereal joy!All I have is a bundle of letters That would sound nothing definite!Hold my arms to touch my warmth,O dear, whisper on my ears soft,Is silence the fall of words or Are words the wreck of silence?
author: Preeth Nambiar, The Solitary Shores

quote: If you really wish to contribute anything worthy to the world
author: offer your silence with smile.

quote: Thy silence, then that voices thee.
author: Herman Melville, Moby-Dick or, The Whale

quote: Wisdom got sound. It is called silence
author: Sameh Elsayed
category: adam-elsayedtood, experience-plus, human-development, joumana-ezz, noha-abdel-hameed, silence, silent, sound, voice, wisdom

quote: Solitude helps the soul remember that life andwork have two completely different meanings. It remindsus that we were created for greatness in relationship withothers, not task lists and spreadsheets.
author: Angela L Craig
category: communication, leadership-characteristics, leadership-traits, leadership-vs-management, pivot-leadership, relationships, silence, solitude

quote: Would the fish have ever been caught if it had kept it’s mouth shut?
author: Ashwin Sanghi

quote: Silence is the song of eternity
author: it is the expression of eternal beauty.

quote: Any species that devours its natural environment will eventually fall victim to the resulting silence and I call the toxicity of silence: Extinction Silence
author: Steven Magee, Curing Electromagnetic Hypersensitivity
category: devour, devoured, devours, environment, environmental, environmental-conservation, environmental-degradation, environmental-protection, environmental-values, environmentalism, extinction, natural, natural-disasters, natural-law, natural-selection, natural-world, naturalism, silence, silence-quote, silenced, species, species-relations, victim, victims

quote: His eyes made a slow scan of my closet doors, which were cracked. "I thought I heard something.""Yeah, well, guess what? I’m a living, breathing person, and every now and then I make noise!
author: Becca Fitzpatrick

quote: Exist outside but live and rest within...
author: Aditya Ajmera

quote: Your silences remain
author: they are your biggest mask.

quote: Silence, like madness, is only comparative.
author: Jacques Yonnet, Paris Noir: The Secret History of a City

quote: This forest silence improves anyone.
author: Robert M. Pirsig, Zen and the Art of Motorcycle Maintenance: An Inquiry Into Values

quote: Like a good Indian, he knew when to talk and when to remain silent. Like a good Indian, he knew there was never a good time to talk.
author: Sherman Alexie, The Toughest Indian in the World

quote: The contact between beings is established only by mute presence, by apparent non-communication, by that mysterious and wordless exchange which resembles inward prayer.
author: Emil M. Cioran

quote: Of all silences I had encountered this was the gravest and most inevitable: not the silence of secrets, but of knowing.
author: Emmi Itäranta, Memory of Water

quote: Best *sometimes it is best not to speakbut just gaze silentlyinto the infinity of your own soul_____________________________rassool jibraeel snyman (c) 2015"The Poetic Assassin
author: rassool jibraeel snyman

quote: The Greenland fjords are peculiar for the spells of completely quiet weather, when there is not enough wind to blow out a match and the water is like a sheet of glass. The kayak hunter must sit in his boat without stirring a finger so as not to scare the shy seals away. Actually, he can only move his eyes, as even the slightest move otherwise might mean game lost. The sun, low in the sky, sends a glare into his eyes, and the landscape around moves into the realm of the unreal. The reflex from the mirror-like water hypnotizes him, he seems to be unable to move, and all of a sudden it is as if he were floating in a bottomless void, sinking, sinking, and sinking.... Horror-stricken, he tries to stir, to cry out, but he cannot, he is completely paralyzed, he just falls and falls.
author: Peter Freuchen, Book of the Eskimos

quote: Most of the conversations we are ever likely to have with people are the things we do not and cannot say
author: Srividya Srinivasan

quote: Love needs expression, Captain Geary, or doubts grow amid the silence. Doubts of the other and doubts of yourself.
author: Jack Campbell, Victorious

quote: The fear of silence is a fear everyone should overcome.
author: Carla H. Krueger
category: author-carla-h-krueger, book-quote, fear, fear-quote, fearless, quiet, silence

quote: At times, productivity means doing nothing at all.
author: Gina Greenlee, Postcards and Pearls: Life Lessons from Solo Moments on the Road
category: be-still, being-vs-doing, do-nothing-and-enjoy-doing-it, meditations-quotes, productivity, productivity-quotes, productivity-tips, silence

quote: I want that love that moved the mountains. I want that love that split the ocean. I want that love that made the winds tremble. I want that love that roared like thunder. I want that love that will raise the dead. I want that love that lifts us to ecstasy. I want that love that is the silence of eternity
author: Jalaluddin Rumi

quote: If we are quiet enough, we can hear it: the space between us filling up fast with all the things we are too afraid to say to each other.
author: Julian Aguon, The Fire This Time: Essays on Life Under Us Occupation

quote: In the name of Him Who created and sustains the world, the Sage Who endowed tongue with speech. He attains no honor who turns the face from the doer of His mercy. The kings of the earth prostate themselves before Him in supplication. He seizes not in haste the disobedient, nor drives away the penitent with violence. The two worlds are as a drop of water in the ocean of His knowledge. He withholds not His bounty though His servants sin; upon the surface of the earth has He spread a feast, in which both friend and foe may share. Peerless He is, and His kingdom is eternal. Upon the head of one He placed a crown another he hurled from the throne to the ground. The fire of His friend He turned into a flower garden; through the water of the Nile He sended His foes to perdition. Behind the veil He sees all, and concealed our faults with His own goodness. He is near to them that are downcast, and accepts the prayers of them that lament. He knows of the things that exist not, of secrets that are untold. He causes the moon and the sun to revolve, and spreads water upon the earth. In the heart of a stone hath He placed a jewel; from nothing had He created all that is. Who can reveal the secret of His qualities; what eye can see the limits of His beauty? The bird of thought cannot soar to the height of His presence, nor the hand of understanding reach to the skirt of His praise. Think not, O Saadi, that one can walk in the road of purity except in the footsteps of Mohammed (Peace and Blessings be Upon Him)
author: Saadi, The Bustan of Sa'di
category: god, love, peace, silence, soul, zen

quote: Seated here in contemplations lost, my thought discovers vaster space beyond, supernal silence and unfathomed peace
author: Giacomo Leopardi
category: bench, contemplation, hike, peace, redwood, silence

quote: Far from such din, when blessed silence returns, I can listen to the butterflies that flutter inside my head. To hear them, one must be calm and pay close attention, for their wingbeats are barely audible. Loud breathing is enough to drown them out. This is astonishing: my hearing does not improve, yet I hear them better and better. I must have butterfly hearing.
author: Jean-Dominique Bauby, The Diving Bell and the Butterfly

quote: It is finally about the quality of the conversations and silences we share, isn't it? We become strangers when we have nothing to say to each other. We die to each other, when the conversations in us die. Sometimes, a little every day, until one day we go completely silent and we are simply left looking at a stranger whose habits we know
author: Srividya Srinivasan

quote: Some people like to hear themselves talk, but I like to hear myself silent.
author: Dean Koontz, Brother Odd

quote: You whispered softly in the ear of my joyous heart.You know what's on my mind, you've heard my thoughts.I closed my mouth and spoke to you in a hundred silent ways.
author: Jalaluddin Rumi

quote: Darkness is a kind of visual silence, and monks love it.
author: Matthew Kelty

quote: In fact, the room was so quiet you might have heard a drop of paint splash.
author: Jasper Fforde, Shades of Grey

quote: And it was so still. The silence of the fields seemed to enter and move familiarly through the house. The wind used the open hall. He felt that he was in a mysterious, quiet, cool danger. It was necessary to do what?...to talk.("Death Of A Traveling Salesman")
author: Eudora Welty, The Collected Stories

quote: It was deep and wide as autumn’s ending. It was heavy as a great river-smooth stone. It was the patient, cut-flower sound of a man who is waiting to die.
author: Patrick Rothfuss, The Name of the Wind

quote: The thing that seemed like silence must have been the endless cry of all the crickets and locusts in the world, rising and falling.("The Wide Net")
author: Eudora Welty, The Collected Stories

quote: In the absence of uplifting words, Silence is the best choice.
author: Joan Ambu

quote: In the woods it was not so much that it was quiet as that the few sounds were loud and distinct, not the orchestra tuning-up of the city but individual grace notes. Birdcalls broken into pieces like a piano exercise, a tree branch snapping sharp and then swishing down and thump on the ground, the hiss of water coming off the mountain.
author: Anna Quindlen, Still Life with Bread Crumbs

quote: I fuckin eat silence of crickets for fun. I got life afterlife and a name like Baby. Every time I try to cry a teara new kittenhead grows out of me.
author: Patricia Lockwood, Motherland Fatherland Homelandsexuals

quote: There is a rest that comes when you live out of your sound. Silence is no longer something to be avoided. It signifies a soul at rest.
author: Suzette R. Hinton

quote: I wanted to close my eyes and let the silence swallow me whole.
author: Benjamin Alire Sáenz, Aristotle and Dante Discover the Secrets of the Universe

quote: Silence is where my demons lurk, taunting me endlessly day after day until the end of time...yet still I wait, revelling in their company...
author: Virginia Alison
category: company, dark, demons, despair, devil, silence

quote: Silence is the best reply to those who provoke you. Smile is like icing on the cake.
author: Saru Singhal

quote: You need to train yourself to be comfortable with silence, particularly when dealing with cultures that respect silence more than we do in the West.
author: Tony Buon, The Leadership Coach
category: communication, silence, silence-communication, silence-quote, silence-speaks, talking, talking-too-much

quote: I never spoke — unless addressed —And then, 'twas brief and low —I could not bear to live — aloud —The Racket shamed me so —And if it had not been so far —And any one I knewWere going — I had often thoughtHow noteless — I could die —
author: Emily Dickinson, Selected Poems

quote: The silence rings—it is musical & thrills me. A night in which the silence was audible—I hear the unspeakable.
author: Henry David Thoreau, The Quotable Thoreau

quote: I've ceased to smile long ago, The bitter winds now chill my lips, Another hope was just let go, Another song was added since. Against my will, I'll cede this song To people's laughter and offense, Because love's silence for the soul Is too unbearably immense.
author: Anna Akhmatova, White Flock

quote: But as the years passed, Ned's silence grew and grew. It pressed upon his face and his body. It leaked into the house and spread outward into the yard. His silence had weight. It had substance and presence and teeth.
author: Kelly Barnhill, The Witch's Boy

quote: The man I meet with is not often so instructive as the silence he breaks.
author: Henry David Thoreau, The Quotable Thoreau

quote: It would never have crossed her mind spontaneously that somebody might actually need silence. That silence helps you to go inward, that anyone who is interested in something more than just life outside actually needs silence: this, I think, is not something Colombe is capable of understanding, because her inner space is as chaotic and noisy as the street outside.
author: Muriel Barbery, The Elegance of the Hedgehog

quote: You have family, only a brother you clearly don't like to speak about. Fine. That's all right." She ran her fingers through her hair. "But don't ever say dreams are a waste. It's a miracle I can still speak of dreams and futures after all I've been through. There's love in this world, Thristan, love that can encompass the heart abiding in humans' mortal, fragile bodies. And there are stupid little humans like me, dreamers, who believe one day they'll find it.
author: Madison Thorne Grey, Silence
category: archangels, fantasy-romance-book-quotes, gwarda-warriors, madison-thorne-grey, paranormal-romance-book-quotes, paranormal-romance-series, silence

quote: Such anger. Do you want to talk about it?" Vincent called out. When there was no reply, Vincent picked up the whistling where he'd left off, smiling at the success of wreaking havoc on Darius. Vincent didn't hate Darius, or any other Gwarda for that matter, he simply got pleasure from messing with the race.
author: Madison Thorne Grey, Silence
category: fantasy-romance-book-quotes, gwarda-warriors, madison-thorne-grey, paranormal-romance-book-quotes, paranormal-romance-quotes, silence, silence-by-madison-thorne-grey

quote: Why are we embarassed by silence? What comfort do we find in all the noise?
author: Mitch Albom, Tuesdays with Morrie

quote: Control said nothing, had said nothing for quite some time as if he didn't trust words anymore. Or had begun to cherish the answers silence gave him.
author: Jeff VanderMeer, Acceptance

quote: Sometimes I feel like I’m not solid. I’m hollow. There’s nothing behind my eyes. I’m a negative of a person. All I want is blackness, blackness and silence.
author: Sylvia Plath

quote: Silence is the communing of a conscious soul with itself.
author: Henry David Thoreau, The Quotable Thoreau

quote: The real in us is silent
author: the acquired is talkative.

quote: It occurred to me that no words by the tongue of man can express the simplicities of a quiet land, so I returned to the river.
author: Daniel J. Rice, The Unpeopled Season: Journal from a North Country Wilderness

quote: First, if any opinion is compelled to silence, that opinion may, for aught we can certainly know, be true. To deny this is to assume our own infallibility. Secondly, though the silenced opinion be an error, it may, and very commonly does, contain a portion of the truth; and since the general or prevailing opinion on any subject is rarely or never the whole truth, it is only by the collision of adverse opinions that the remainder of the truth has any chance of being supplied.
author: John Stuart Mill, On Liberty

quote: When the mind is silent, you can listen to your heart and remember that everything is Love and that you are that Love.
author: Human Angels, We are human angels
category: angel, angels, oneness, silence, silence-speaks, unconditional-love

quote: A word is worth one coin, silence is worth two
author: Chaim Potok, The Chosen

quote: The question is there in each silence. The question is there in the space between you. But you cannot bring it aloud.
author: David Levithan, How They Met, and Other Stories

quote: You are never alone,your Angels always whisper to your heart.By silencing your mind,you can be filled with their Love.
author: Human Angels, 365 Wisdom Pills

quote: Pagans can be just as monstrous as any other group. They can be murderers, rapists, pedophiles. We need to accept that they are our problem and deal with them. We need to speak against their crimes and challenge them rather than letting our silence make us complicit.
author: Thomm Quackenbush, Pagan Standard Times: Essays on the Craft
category: complicit, crimes, monsters, pagans, pedophiles, rapist, silence

quote: I totally allow myselfto feel every emotion,whatever it isand I observe itfrom my inner spaceof love and silence.
author: Human Angels, 365 Mantras for today

quote: Silence is golden...but in times of tyranny it is blood red
author: Parag Tipnis

quote: The silence was pregnant with noise, with muted fury, with questions the father found too disgusting to frame and with answers to which the son was incapable of giving voice.
author: Johnny Rich, The Human Script

quote: Thinking belongs to duality. Love belongs to the Oneness. There is no thought without judgment, there is no Unconditional Love without the silence of the mind.
author: Human Angels, We are human angels
category: angel, angels, oneness, silence, silence-speaks, unconditional-love

quote: For ten years after the atomic bomb was dropped there was so little public discussion of the bomb or of radioactivity that even the Chugoku Shinbun, the major newspaper of the city where the atomic bomb was dropped, did not have the movable type for 'atomic bomb' or 'radioactivity'. The silence continued so long because the U.S. Army Surgeons Investigation Team in the fall of 1945 had issued a mistaken statement: all people expected to die from the radiation effects of the atomic bomb had by then already died; accordingly, no further cases of physiological effects due to residual radiation would be acknowledged.
author: Kenzaburō Ōe
category: a-bomb, atomic-bomb, censorship, hiroshima, public-discussion, radiation-effects, radioactivity, silence

quote: Clear your mind and you will be filled by the Love of the Oneness.
author: Human Angels, We are human angels

quote: -not only did he deplore the waste of words, he detested the moral lassitude with which they were wasted. To him, in whose throat the bone of displacement was forever stuck, it was wrong to talk about nothing when there was a perpetual shortage of words for all the horrible things that happened in the world. It was better to be silent than to say what didn't matter.
author: Aleksandar Hemon, The Book of My Lives

quote: Canoes, too, are unobtrusive; they don't storm the natural world or ride over it, but drift in upon it as a part of its own silence. As you either care about what the land is or not, so do you like or dislike quiet things--sailboats, or rainy green mornings in foreign places, or a grazing herd, or the ruins of old monasteries in the mountains. . . . Chances for being quiet nowadays are limited.
author: John Graves

quote: Quiet, by its nature, slips away unnoticed. But once it's gone, we notice.
author: Susan  Marsh, A Hunger for High Country: One Woman's Journey to the Wild in Yellowstone Country

quote: A kind of silence, if I may say, was walking through the house, and, like most silence, it was not silent at all: it rapped on the doors, echoed in the clocks, creaked on the stairs, leaned forward to peer into my face and explode.
author: Truman Capote

quote: Silence has always been my default mode—my best defense against the rest of the world.
author: Matthew Quick, Boy21

quote: Silence is not empty or immaterial, and it is not needed to chain tame things. It often guards powers strong enough to shatter everything.
author: Emmi Itäranta, Memory of Water

quote: We didn't talk much, and the silence hung like a silk curtain, light and lovely.
author: Katherine Reay, Dear Mr. Knightley

quote: I see myself abandoned, solitary, thrown into a cell without dimensions, where light and shadows are silent phantoms. Within my inner self I find the silence I am seeking. But it leaves me so bereft of any memory of any human being and of me myself, that I transform this impression into the certainty of physical solitude. Were I to cry out — I can no longer see things clearly — my voice would receive the same indifferent echo from the walls of the earth.
author: Clarice Lispector, Near to the Wild Heart

quote: Always, just beyond all these things, was the silver sea, the lace border around all land like the silence around sounds or the unknowns beyond all knowledge.
author: Rebecca Solnit, The Faraway Nearby

quote: If silences could be pregnant, then this one went to full term.
author: Alison Weir

quote: She drifted down into the water, letting it engulf her body until even her face was underwater. The silence was delicious, just the sound of her own heartbeat in her ears.
author: Crissi Langwell, The Road to Hope

quote: Christmas
author: silence breathed childlike anticipation in your heart.

quote: In general, silence often reflects ambiguity on the part of the listener as the observer wishes to understand the other's experience.
author: Sandra Leanne Bosacki

quote: Sarah...loved the way the light lit the silence first thing in the morning.
author: Niamh Boyce, The Herbalist

quote: Of silence, I can say only what I heard, that all things are known by that which they make or leave–and so speech isn’t itself, but its effect, and silence is the same.
author: Jesse Ball, Silence Once Begun

quote: I'm very depressed how in this country you can be told "That's offensive" as though those two words constitute an argument.
author: Christopher Hitchens
category: atheism, blasphemy, critical-thinking, debate, emotional, gag, logic, manipulation, political-correctness, religion, silence

quote: There is a presence, a silence, a stillness which is here by itself. There is no doer of it, no creator of this stillness. It is simply here in you, with you. It is the fragrance of your own self. There is nothing to do about this, it is naturally present. This fragrance of peace, this spaciousness, it is the fragrance of your own being.
author: Mooji

quote: An observer can’t tell if a person is silent and still because inner life has stalled or because inner life is transfixingly busy.
author: Susanna Kaysen, Girl, Interrupted

quote: When the owl sings, the night is silent. (Quand le hibou chante, La nuit est silence)
author: Charles de Leusse
category: hibou, night, nuit, owl, silence, silent

quote: People reveal as much by their silence as they do by what they say.
author: Sandra Brown, Deadline

quote: When something is Festering on your memory or in your imagination, laws of silence don't work, it's just like shutting a door and locking it on a house on fire in hope of forgetting that the house is burning. But not facing a fire doesn't put it out. Silence about a thing just magnifies it. It grows and festers in silence, becomes malignant...
author: Tennessee Williams, Cat on a Hot Tin Roof

quote: The silence was enchanting. Infinite space seemed to enter it, and my spirit, alone with the stars, seemed capable of any adventure.
author: W. Somerset Maugham, The Summing Up

quote: Reading haiku is as much an art as writing it. The reader needs to pause and listen to the silences, to feel the spaces between the words, and to journey into the depths of many multi-colored worlds.
author: Harley King, Mother, Don't Lock Me In That Closet!
category: haiku, journey, poetry, reading, silence, writing

quote: But sometimes, things are better to just hear. Some questions better left unasked. Some words better left unsaid. Because saying them doesn’t make you matter any less.
author: A. Lynn, Itsy's Ugly

quote: The true hero trains himself in silence.
author: Kristian Goldmund Aumann

quote: The constant talker will never, or a least rarely, grasp truth. Of course even he must experience some truths, otherwise he could not exist. He does notice certain facts, observe certain relations, draw conclusions and make plans.
